tx9n6wKhab3FMbtnOPvOuA.text: This is a wonderful little Greek restaurant. The service was rather speedy, and the salmon kabobs were very tasty. The waitress even gave me a free cookie! Prices are fairly good for what they serve, and the outdoor seating isn't too bad either. All in all, great little place for lunch or dinner.

uL0cXQtC1ldOzRhKhBQXjA.text: This wasn't really greek food - it was more like fast food in a greek form factor.  It was not authentic at all.  Service was okay - yes it was high school kids but they were pretty great with the free refills.  If you are craving greek food this might not hit the spot.

zIRMgqXucTR99R-LxRDvjg.text: As someone who listens to Vampire Weekend, I crave falafel and let me tell you this place is delicious. I got the falafel sandwich and it by far exceeded expectations. The place in general might seem a bit dated (they won some award for being the best at something in 1998) but if you are hungry for mediterranean food and you are in the area Akropolis will hit the spot.

Jv9hDo7mWG5rj9XdeaAWLA.text: I went here for lunch a couple of months ago. The service was not very impressive,  tables were wobbling and diner looks outdated. I wasn't impress with the food either, very bland! Somehow it took me over 30 minutes to get my food.

AAQpK7gwgLIZIVoD58Amnw.text: I am very disappointed. I placed an order and it was not correct when given to me. The fries were cold and my gyro was not as I requested. I requested a refund and was told no refunds. I just read another review who had a similar complaint and the same issue. I have ate here before but never will again. I was told to call Mike Sadri after 2pm to speak with him. I am beyond pissed. I will definitely be giving him a call.

clOvkV-N5Vdy_kEanUYo1w.text: So where do I start. Let's just say I would never eat here again mind you this was my first time. Hands down the worst dinning experience of my life. My friend ordered a Greek salad and as she's eating she found a worm moving around in her food she then got up and went to the bathroom to vomit. As my friend was dying in the bathroom I then called over a staff member to make her aware that a worm was in the salad. The young lady had no remorse or sympathy to the fact that we had a live insect in the food. She looked at me rolled her eyes and said "what will you like us to do?"  I asked to speak to a manger she then proceeded to tell me that there wasnt  a manger there. A more decent place would have apologized. But no instead we still had to pay for the Greek salad with a side of worms. This place is a dump and should not even be in business. We don't want restaurants like this in our area!!!!! Keep you nasty attitude and salads away. P.S Any decent restaurant should have a manager in duty to make sure the guest are recovering a proper dining experience.

EHI2yjMaoTDLHgGyGHoSvA.text: Great food, consistent and good value. Gyro Platter is good! #6 very good. Greek salads always good.

nDEU5J9vcJVi3UXA5kzLcA.text: We go here for the falafel sandwich. It's consistently good and a pairing of fries with hot sauce always does the trick. Ask for extra tahini and enjoy.

OwNpXizDAcLyfc9LeiKPeQ.text: Some of the best gyro I've had in Charlotte. They are BUSY at lunch time and food can take a while, but it's always been worth the wait. I have never had stale pita, which I have ended up with just about everywhere else I've eaten gyro frequently. I love the platter with salad and fries as well!

yOqQYHs7neso8vp82UxHOA.text: Busy place. Menu has a Mish mash of things, from gyros to lasagne. I had the gyro platter and DH had the gyro and pork kabob platter. First off, the gyro meat reminds me of meatloaf in texture and it was very salty. They put some kind of gravy on it. The Greek salad was good. Fries...well, they're fries. Signs everywhere saying, "We work for tips." However, aside from bringing the food to the table they really don't do much to earn a tip. In addition, we paid with a card and there wasn't a line for a tip anyway. Overall, tried it once. Will not go again.

m7WgF6StKk99L5Msewyv_A.text: The menu in the store is nothing like the one online, standard fast food Greek fare, nothing special. Very disappointing.

16YxZridLD0Te4KxAGUqAw.text: I was doing some window-shopping and my stomach reached up and punched me in the face.  I fell into a Greek restaurant which I could deal with because I love falafel.  The noticed that the cafe was loaded with teenie-bobber couples, probably from the high school across the street.  Oh well, I spotted a few quiet places available for me to enjoy my meal.    The cashier seemed unenthusiastic and her she wore her hat so low that it looked like she was trying to hide something.  I ordered the falafel with a side of fries.    The food popped up within ten minutes and the place was crowded!  I enjoyed my waitress, she had a sweet personality and quick on the refills.  The unsalted French fries were huge and steamy and the Falafel was hot and crunchy.  I do have a suspicion that the fafalel was frozen and recooked, but good nonetheless.  They played Smashing Pumpkins, Honey, and I thought for a minute about dessert, but I had to run.  Baklava next time!

E3mkNc1SVIHpbKL1fQOn4g.text: where to begin...the food was so authentically Greek i almost lost my appetite BUT the spanakopita was out. of. this. world. so crispy. so fresh. so delicious, and ever so slightly salty with a bit of spinach (go iron!). the fries were a bit too hot, but after much blowing, from both me and my child, they were cool enough to bite. the star of the meal was by far the tzatziki sauce - thick, white, and perfectly spiced - my baby even drank it! and used a pita as a spoon! all those wonderful things aside (except for salad because i don't eat salad) the low stance of this rating stems from the judgmental, rude, hurtful stares from the customers when i walked inside with my baby. i was banished to attempt to enjoy my meal outside while the other customers mingled indoors. my baby may have to learn to drink tzatziki sauce elsewhere but as for me, ill be back. never be afraid to go greek! #gogreekorgohome

MkPamWZGN_usKN6GzGWhNA.text: I've been going to Akropolis since it was put into the Arboretum.    The atmosphere has never been much to write home about.  They close a week or two out of the year to usually clean/repaint the place but it always meets south of expectation.  The tables are loud, the chairs they use heavy as anything and louder still.  The service is usually wage (or sub) high school students and you know how that can go.  That's not what it's about though.. it is the food right?  I think they have the best gyro meat in town.  While it's not like leaving the country and having lamb/steak on a spit it is served fresh and well spiced.  Others in town that you get gyros from will serve you some Cisco food service derivative which is freaky.  Their Chicken and kabobs are also juicy and never dry.  You could rank a lot of complaints on this place if you weren't careful but I've been to them long enough and a repeat customer for probably 15+ years and they continually draw me back a few times a month.

s_54kvE_gBnNcWrfhXnZKA.text: The spinach pie is yummy, and the french fries are good. It's a standard Greek restaurant, and the food will hit the spot if you have a hankering for Greek. The service leaves a lot to be desired. It's slow, and the high-school age staff are often a little fussy about being interrupted from whatever it is they were doing to have to work.   One of the waittresses flirted openly with my date in a way I found pretty yucky...it was a bizarre combination of indifference to providing timely, quality customer service while fawning over my man...Boo to her.  If you've got time to wait, though, and you're not with a dashingly handsome man, and you're willing to suffer through some sloppy service to get to the promised land of souvlaki and spanokopita, Akropolis is a good option. It's pretty affordable as well, so it's a nice option to the Taco Bell across the parking lot in the Arboretum.

9YvM8gL1H_Iqy8DWVcY3DA.text: I am a big fan of Greek food.  I ordered a greek gyros platter which consisted of greek salad and gyros and I had them leave out the pita bread and fries.  The gyros was a processed, almost spam like tasting gyros.  It was nothing compared to the kind and quality of gyros you would get at other Greek Restaurants in town.  It had a rubbery, processed reddish tint to it and the low grade processed taste I would never had paid nearly 8.00 for if I knew what it was.  I left almost the entire platter.  Never again.

3RsZhD3-kFTg2TCKcHqBHQ.text: We have always enjoyed this restaurant - the food is very good.  Tonight however, the customer service fell below my expectations.  I brought home some chicken strips home for my son (in their styrofoam takeout containers) and the chicken strips melted through the styrofoam because the cooks put them in there when they were still too hot.  He had eaten about 1/2 of the meal before he had noticed the holes at the bottom of the container.  We were extremely concerned of the chemicals from the stryofoam that our son may have just injested and told him to stop eating immediately.  When i brought the container and remaining food back to the restaurant i expected either a refund or an alternative option to the food we were returning (since the thought of eating styrofoam had blown his appetite for that particular dish).  Restaurant policy is replacement of the same exact dish, regardless of cost.  I expected a more customer friendly policy.

khrdVYLiEftRf2Z-FIdaSQ.text: This place must be alright cause I keep coming back and have been doing so for years. So why only 3 stars? Well, the service is hit or miss. And you have to stand in line and place your order, just like  you would at say McDonalds. After your order is placed then the vibe switches to a wait staff environment where they bring food to your table when your order is ready (and tipping is expected - as the note at the cash register reminds you). I always find those set ups annoying.

ov-IqugZrNGmnj_1ExS7cg.text: Usually I am really happy with my meals here when David and I are in the mood for a quick casual bite on a Sunday night.  However, last night things were just a bit off.. the salad wasn't as fresh as normal and was doused with wayyy too much vinegarette.  The chicken soulvaki was cooked ok, but the tzatziki sauce didn't seem to be on pointe - couldn't quite put my finger on it.  The only other issue is that the piece of Baklava that David & I split was really hard.   :-(    Hopefully, things will be back up to par on our next visit.

0DnkgWSyeMhVF8qTDgsbcA.text: Voted Best in Charlotte 17 years ago, this was probably the last time any pride was given to this establishment. To start, the decor and food is very outdated and bland. The worst part, however, is the service. Untrained, preoccupied high school kids running the entire front of house operation, wow!  Hot tip: Don't sit at the bar, it is also used as the bussing station.

0RpOoXSjpn7O0KMzg3ppqg.text: I usually try extremely hard not to give mediocre to bad reviews but the food was just not good.  My expectations weren't super high I don't think but then when I tasted the gyro I was disappointed.  I thought that a gyro would be a safe choice considering it is a Greek restaurant but no the meat was not at all tasty.  The tzatziki sauce left much to be desired and I was just disappointed.  The staff was super friendly consisting of mostly young people and the restaurant was pretty well maintained, price points are low... But with good reason.  It's not great. I come from NYC, land of the cheap and quick gyro served up from a food cart or full service restaurant sometimes guaranteed to give you heart burn and this fell short of that even.  I'm afraid I won't be back.

lr6SP1hgqo1X5iRpY0PTbA.text: Akrapolis Arboretum-Poorly managed, poorly run Greek restaurant. Manager is rude and does not hesitate to berate customers for mistakes that the restaurant makes. Mistakes on orders are frequent and the food is at best mediocre.

RfgevuDsshK5AyP59cGMuA.text: This used to be my favorite Greek restaurant, but it has gone downhill so much in the past few years that I probably won't go again.  Everything appears dirty and greasy -- from the nasty floors to the wobbly tables with very old plastic table covers. The service stinks, the bathrooms stink, and the place just looks gross. The food is okay -- not as good as it used to be.

6QNaUSfxTaO37rD7WjWS6Q.text: BF had suggested this place, I lived down the street from it previously for years and never tried but they were busy for a middle of the week lunch and the menu look good. We started with the hummus... it was cool and creamy served with warm pita bread, I would go back for this alone. I ordered a plate that came with a small greek salad, steak fries and a grilled chicken skewer with a side of tzatziki. The salad had fresh crispy romaine, some of the best goat cheese Ive had, onions, olives, carrots (maybe? cant remember!) and cukes. The chicken was very tender and the marinated was good, the tzatziki was cool and creamy and worked perfectly with the dish. For a little over $7 this was a great deal. BF opted for the burger and fries and he enjoyed the burger, nothing fancy but he said it was better than he had expected.  Service was good, they came by often to check on us and made sure our drinks were refilled. We enjoyed sitting outside, relaxing and enjoying a good meal.

dqVs4zM00aKZN3S1iW17-w.text: We missed lunch and stopped ther for just a bite around 2 pm. There was just a few costumers but we were standing at the counter waiting to order for over 10 minutes while a waitress was talking to someone eating at the counter and ignoring us the whole time. I glared at her until she got uncomfortable, said her shift was over and left the restaurant.   The girl she was talking to turned to be an employee, she finally got up, apologized and took our order.  We sat down and when our order came this other server didn't bring any settings, we actually had to call her back for it. She thought that was funny. I got the impression they only hire high school girls.  The spanakopita appetizer was actually quite tasty but the portion was way too small, 4 bite sized pies Hey spinach pie is not a luxury item! The grape leafs were run of the mill. No lamb gyro or kabab? Only beef and chicken, I have no use for a beef Gyro. The funny thing is that at the Charlotte cafe right next door they serve lamb Gyro and they don't even claim to be a Greek eatery.   Not convinced

C2kUVlKWAWnKZGFghLMO6A.text: They get one star because they, in fact, serve food. The customer service is atrocious. The "cheeseburger" had no cheese but "you can pay extra for it". If you ask to substitute a side, they offer the substitutions but fail to say that it will cost you $4 extra. They could only provide plastic ware because all of the flatware was dirty. Hmmm, this somewhere you want to eat? I think not.

Vaf9dz4mJwHsm0FK297MAQ.text: The one star represents the restaurant's lack of effort on customer satisfaction. If you make a to go order at this restaurant, make sure it is exactly right before leaving. They will not try to make their screw up "right" on your next visit. The food may be good, but customer satisfaction should go hand in hand! If you want good Greek and good customer satisfaction, go to showmars.!

p92Owh3cjX6JlS4zUsF3HA.text: We have been coming here off and on ever since this place opened.  We have seen a high turn over in servers over the more recent years and today I understand why. We ordered 2 diet cokes with our meal in to go cups.  We stood at the counter and watched the girl fill our drinks as we thought we would save her the trouble of bringing them to the table.  She filled up the first to go cup with regular coke and put a lemon in it (which, I think, usually goes into a diet coke). So we thought maybe this isn't our order.  We watched as she filled the second to go cup with regular coke and again put a lemon in it. Hummm, surely this must not be our order.   She turned around, we told her we were waiting for 2 diet cokes, and even asked, Are those diet cokes? and she starts to hand them to us.  I told her, we just watched you fill them with regular coke.  She just smiled, never said I'm sorry...or... oh I made a mistake...or... isn't that a funny joke to switch regular coke and diet coke, nothing.  She emptied them out and filled them with diet coke as we watched her.  After we sat down, another waitress came over and was very apologetic but with servers like the one who thinks it's funny to fill orders with coke when diet coke was ordered, we probably will not go back. Good thing I am not a diabetic.

1sGskdmBB9plFOcdrclh5A.text: Delicious Hidden Gem. Husband and I took a chance on this place a couple months ago and so glad we did: FOOD: Freshly made. Highly recommend the gyros. This restaurant has a big variety of options - everything from chili to salmon kabobs to baklava. While this may seem unfocused to some, we found the options delicious.  Parking: It is located in a very busy shopping center and the parking can be challenging.  Atmosphere: It's a diner/hole in the wall atmosphere - tables are very close together but it's cozy. Local hint: There is a small lake behind the restaurant - highly recommend getting the food to go and enjoying it outside with a water view.

qlFh21aOhbWX3Xzjid8OJw.text: Service is absolutely terrible. It's a bunch of teenage girls with the biggest attitudes. The place is so nasty and looks as if it's never been cleaned. There is never a manager, so when you have an issue it is never taken care of. This place is an absolute joke....

r0_Hyml-F7ctyfXUtuK5eQ.text: I wish this restaurant was closer to me!  I have been going there for over 12 years and I love it all the time!

ch4NHXaj-PF9inffZFoGmA.text: Used to be a great little joint for a quick salad and bowl of soup. But the past few months the service has become a real problem. Too many teenagers, not enough adults.

kQ1A14U9hB45es6qi5EE9g.text: One of the places I have to visit whenever I'm in town. Food is exactly what I expect every time. Service was excellent today. All of the servers passed by several times and checked in each time, returning quickly with anything we needed. Location is looking a bit tired, but that's my only complaint.

4RLsxmcYU6ACacRxD2lqqg.text: The food is consistently delicious. The staff is young so somewhat distracted but nice. Usually there are more employees than customers and they (employees) are usually eating at the counter. Not sure if on their break or off and hanging out or ? I would suggest designating a place in the far back of the restaurant for them to dine.

1Ph746Rrt2IUJQqdJAH1Qg.text: Usually go in there for the Gyro Combo - with fries and a drink it runs $7.50. Great flavor, just the right amount of Tzatiki and the fries are fresh and crisp!

HscLEQuaaZ6Sa91pY4kfHg.text: I feel like this place has gotten a bum rap. My food--a chicken souvlaki appetizer and a grape leaf appetizer got to me quickly. It was fresh and good. The menu was overwhelming though! I could not figure out what to get without having to get French fries. I ended up getting the two appetizers.

pI-QGfJbMUeJAE6z6Spiow.text: I officially love this little restaurant.  I've seen it around in my travels and finally decided to go try it, and I'm sure glad I did.  The inside is painted to look like a Greek villa complete with a great view of the beach, which I thought was cute.    As far as the food goes, I was ready to mark them down a bit for having slow service but then the food finally arrived and all bad thoughts were banished.  My chicken suvlaki kabobs were cooked perfectly and served with fresh, hot pita bread, and Greek dipping sauce.  This restored my faith in them because even though the place was nearly full and they were understaffed (I saw a help wanted sign in the window) they took the time to make sure every dish was done well.    They also have some American fair, like hamburgers and such for those afraid of international cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Akropolis Cafe At Arboretum - Charlotte, NC, United States

UmNle1ujXrK9jU9U_PZwCQ.text: I love this place. My family has been eating here for years and I really make an effort to get in when I'm back in town.  This is an order at the counter type of place so it's not fancy but the food is fast and good.  I've looked around wherever I've lived for a greek place I like as well, but so far have been unsuccessful.    I mostly get the gyro platter which is great.  It comes with greek salad and those wide yellowish french fries that seem to be common to greek places.  I'm not a fan of the fries myself so I always order it with no fries and extra salad.  It only comes with half a pita bread though, so If you like to put the meat and salad together in the pita to eat (like I do) I suggest you invest less than a buck in an extra order of pita bread.  We also like the stuffed grape leaves if you are in the mood for an appetizer, but the gyro platter is usually big enough without anything else.

1hgZQTvbsMzqcnNp0YIKrA.text: Food is always great here but the young people that work the front register are some of the rudest people to deal with. They always seem to be mad about something and never have a smile on their face. Doesn't keep me from coming back for more food but still is bothersome.

qOaISy6q-kyutB0P_QURGg.text: This is probably the second time that I've visited this year. Good food but slow service and nobody asks you if everything is okay with your meal or if you need refills.

y2bDOUnzQ0VrTeeSqZg6eA.text: I'm a little surprised by all the negative reviews. I've been coming here since I was a kid so there may be a little bit of nostalgia coloring my view but the food here really is quite good for the price.  This is fast food type Greek so it's definitely not fancy but it's reasonably priced and tasty. Anything with chicken in it is a good bet here. It's tender and very flavorful as a result of being marinated in Greek spices. Akropolis also has some of the best Greek dressing I've ever had. I pretty much put it in everything. It's excellent on the French fries and on the Greek rice in addition to the salad. I'm a big fan of their spanakopita because it's served in very small little triangles and has the perfect filling to dough ratio. I'm not a fan of big slices of spanikopita because there's too much spinach and too little crunch from the phyllo dough.  I'll readily admit Akropolis doesn't have the best service. The staff here is always made up of really young high school kids and a lot of them fool around behind the counter instead of getting the food out promptly. This can be kind of annoying but realistically, you usually can't expect excellent customer service at a quick service restaurant and since I'm never paying a lot here, I can deal with a few instances of fifteen year olds slacking off.   This may not be a must visit spot in Charlotte but it's a great spot to stop for a quick, casual meal while shopping at the Arboretum.

JKw-ws2_-dHYUa0_gZVyvg.text: This is easily the worst restaurant in the Arboretum. If you are looking for a nice lunch or dinner, do not go here! My mother and I went to this restaurant for lunch, and everything was horrible. The lettuce was covered in a very watery dressing and was sitting in a puddle of water on the plate! The tenderloin skewers tasted like they had been pulled out of the fridge and microwaved. There were entirely too many fries on the plate, and they were pretty dry. The bread was not fresh, the meat was dry, and the tzatziki sauce was more like mayonnaise. My mother, who had the sweet tea, said that is kind of tastes like they used instant tea. She said she didn't know that you could mess up sweet tea, but they did. It's an insult to Greek food. The atmosphere of the restaurant itself was dirty and not at all fresh, like a cafe should be. It felt more like McDonalds. Please, any place is better than here.

hJwEhhDjrCXJ5cGMqIaNXw.text: This place deserves more then a 2.5 star rating. I ordered the #13. Souvlaki chicken kabob platter. I loved the salad dressing. Reminded me of the dressing my mom use the make. Just the right herbs with oil and vinegar.  Fries were cooked to perfection. The chicken kabob was cooked perfect and the taziki sauce I could drink. Staff was kind and attentive. Definitely will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Akropolis Cafe At Arboretum - Charlotte, NC, United States. #13. Souvlaki chicken kabob platter. Yum!!

ke3yJJ58kJ6x7YGlF6ZdJg.text: Fantastic lunch served super fast by a friendly staff in a clean dining room, perfect! Oh yeah, not expensive either. Had the #6 ...Marinated Chicken over rice and added a side order of hummus. All were delicious. The manager "Lupe" came out of the kitchen and asked everyone if everything was good, and grabbed me a refill of my tea, a nice touch these days.  Take your friends and family, we need to keep this place around because they care about their customers.

FeWWw2rHMw78CHjrwL6cQQ.text: My favorite place to order to go when I want something quick and healthy and at a reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Akropolis Cafe At Arboretum - Charlotte, NC, United States

RwHHsDBBrRKBmym3rtr-Dw.text: I truly enjoy the food at the Akrop; it's the main thing that keeps me coming back. In the past, I have had an expired coupon denied. Just today, a lady working the counter already assumed my coupon was expired before even looking. I feel like the customer service needs an overall attitude change. Also, the food takes a pretty long time to make it to the table/take-out. I understand they serve great food but that isn't the only thing that makes a restaurant worthy of patronage.

IoHGI5OhgS6xQzFuemfb7w.text: Interesting experience. Although it looks like a diner, you place your order at a counter and they bring it to you. However the service was very disappointing. The cashier who took my order payed more attention to the customer, a guy behind me, than I. I ordered the chicken kebab dinner, with fries, a Greek salad, and pita bread for $7.99, not a bad price. However, I waited over 20 minutes for my food and not be given a #, the servers just walk around and see who it belongs to. So, the chicken was seasoned great, and I enjoyed the sauce and pita bread, but the Greek salad was bland and the fries cold and not cooked or hard a rock. Not the best Greek in my mind.

JwOoQcrQOK09UAz6_KqrwA.text: Terrible customer service. Run by a family that thinks all customers out to cheat them or something. Placed a Togo order and they said 10 minutes. I go there and only when I paid did they put the order in and I had to wait after for another 10 -15 mins. Just dumb. Food is all right. Go to plantation market and kebab hot instead.

UqRHgC87OjKHvpwn54qHfg.text: It's unfortunate that I can't speak to someone after two attempts (via phone and in person) when I get home with a wrong to go order.   Bad customer service will run me away.  Too bad since we eat here about 4 times a month. ..

ocJGA9IUvtAFQsB66b8U9g.text: This place isn't going to be the NYC gyro, but it's decent and well-priced. Depending on who the cooks are that day, the food may have more or less flavor. The owner is a good guy, but isn't there nearly as often as he used to be. The staff are mostly local teens (girls). Most of them are quite nice. If the line is long, just know you will need to be patient as the staff is young and isn't as focused on customer service as adults would be.  All in all, this is a place I get a craving for every month or two. Service is what it is, but a side of gyro meat, pita, and tzatziki hits the spot!! Be aware -- you can ask for crispier pita at the counter or when you call in your order :)  Happy eating!!

nTSbXeZ-ymXjSYjGXlu0CA.text: Skip this place.  Totally disorganized.  I had a gyro, meat was dry, taziki sauce flavorless.  The frys were inedible, cooked in old oil.  They have a lot of people working there, most of them just standing around and yet they cannot figure out gets which order.  I won't be back.

ZtupiYYivqDs2I8W6MsxPQ.text: Great falafel at a super low-key restaurant. I was not a fan of the falafel sandwhich, because it was wrapped in a thick pita and I am used to a traditional middle eastern thin pita, but the actual falafel ball itself was tasty. And the food arrived piping hot which is lovely.   Definitely worth visiting for a casual lunch.

kPfxYSDWSry_ZftzSNn7Sg.text: My favorite little Greek place for the past two decades - the tzatziki dip is addictive. Go for a kabob platter and sample the Greek salad, steak fries, and grilled meat along with pita bread. The turnover is low and the servers seem happy, prices are reasonable and takeout is fast enough for a quick lunch break.

dC74j_P0QWKq7gjTFs_k1A.text: Alas I found a location that serves simply good, inexpensive Greek food. The grilled chicken is great. The pork kabobs are delicious as well. Their house made dressing is fantastic. Service is a so so. You order and pay for your meal at the counter and they bring it to you but friendly.

6C5Tuaj80BQdCmz01kTtyQ.text: Great food! Atmosphere needs help. Employees gathered in the middle eating both behind the counter and seated. Not paying attention to customers. Place needs better management and a facelift.

5rbVP3KZ4Wb0O8z1Rk9cZQ.text: Food is good, service and cleanliness need major improvement. Teen staff mostly ate and was clueless to the customer, Moire mature servers, steam clean the place, would be a great experience.

FkeLB7ILpwQFj9ns2UBzEw.text: Akropolis has a diner feel about it.  They had a bbq sandwich special.  They have some traditional greek items souvlaki, falafel  and the obligatory  hot dog and  burgers.  Somewhere you can spend $6 and get a sandwich.  There were a lot of employees in there.  I think I saw 6 employees and the owner.    I ordered the falafel, it was a bit overcooked simply topped with onion, lettuce and tomato, served with tahini, of course I wanted some tzatziki.  I have had better but all in all, it won me over.  They serve large cut steak fries, they looked delish!    It took a lot of will power not to add an order.  They were very pleasant, food came out hot.  It didn't set the world on fire but there is something appealing about the cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Akropolis Cafe At Arboretum - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Akropolis Cafe At Arboretum - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Akropolis Cafe At Arboretum - Charlotte, NC, United States

4yPwsasJeEERRNwZlErFpQ.text: This place is a joke. Poorly run and mediocre food. Called in an order for takeout - a whole 2 items and they forgot to include one meal when we came to pick it up! Plus we ordered from the online menu and I tried to order a couple things that she said weren't available. Then as I was asking the girl about the combo platter (probably my 3rd question) she told me the menu online isn't up to date. One, wouldn't you tell me that up front? Two, why wouldn't they pay someone a hundred bucks to update the website?! So inconvenient for both sides.  Now the food - aside from the order being wrong, when we got home (only 3 minutes away) the pork was so dry it was hard to chew. The grilled chicken had way too much garlic in it and the pita was soggy and flavorless. They offered a to-go menu on our way out but we didn't take it. We'll never be back.

SVilCorz405Daz9Lum4sjQ.text: It's been a few years since I was last at Akropolis. It is as I remembered and expected. The food is very good and the service pleasant.    David Match

0E3WtNq0qXq01NbkwU--eQ.text: I can't believe I haven't tried this place sooner! It was really good, I don't understand all the low star reviews. I had a lunch special and it was such a reasonable price. I chose the steak kabob which comes with a salad and pita. The tzatziki sauce was also very delicious.   The service was awesome, they were friendly and quick. I would most certainly not only recommend this place, but come back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Akropolis Cafe At Arboretum - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak kabob

pMe7e_qSeO2600cTjAS7Wg.text: Went here a number of times when visiting family in the area.  At that time there was table service for the wide variety of Greek dishes.  Wife and I went in on a Saturday for a late lunch.  Not crowded at all.  And it appeared to us that they had expanded the interior, put in more tables and also did away with table service.  You order from a pretty large menu on the wall above the kitchen.  The person at the cash register takes your order, you pay and the food is brought to your table.    We just wanted gyros and ended up having gyro platters, which were cheaper than the sandwich and a drink.  So we got good french fries, tea and a nice fat gyro wrapped in aluminum foil with tzatziki sauce.  Pretty disappointing for both of us.  As mentioned, fries were good, but the gyro was pretty blah.  They emphasize that they serve beef gyros and I think that is why they lacked flavor.  Also, the pita bread was flavorless and a bit tough.    If you want more tzatziki sauce it is $.99.    This could have been a two-star, but it is convenient in the Arboretum Shopping center and you can get a reasonable lunch that would satisfy most people.  We have just had better gyro meats, so will go to other places in lieu of coming back here.

qWpqGoVNiahXEyVPiNUopg.text: Love this place. Great gyros and steak fries. I stop in whenever I'm in the area. It might not look too fancy but it's a perfect place for Greek food.

agWft3kH95PcB4E6L-cY3w.text: Horrible customer service! The worst EVER! From the wait staff to the cook to the manager HORRIBLE! Atmosphere is pathetic. Food is over priced garbage.

0oajo77x1yiOTQAyYx0nlA.text: This is my first Yelp rating.  I usually would not do this sort of thing but it has become necessary.  The food at the Akropolis Cafe at the Arboretum is fine.  Nothing amazing but more than edible.  A decent meal.  However, the customer service is atrocious.  Abysmal.  There is clearly no manager.  I have been there countless times and have never witnessed the slightest inkling of organization.  A really pathetic customer service experience.  Could be a good spot with the least bit of effort by management (if there is management).

IomuwBFCvajFtSCKYDMA4g.text: The gyro meat was very salty and poor quality. The Greek salads were dressed with watered down olive oil. I was very unimpressed by the food. The service was weird and unorganized, but more importantly the food left a lot to be desired.

5ZxJVs1vyi7b3tBjtxP3jQ.text: Bizarrely rude customer service.  I ordered a salad (with hot chicken) and did not get any silverware.  The server said she would bring some. After 5-10 minutes of my food cooling, I went to find some silverware. I was told it was being washed and I would have to wait.  I asked if she had plastic forks and she said yes, but I could not have any.  So I went back to my table (perplexed).  After a few more minutes I asked again for plasticware and was told I would have to wait for silverware to be washed.  I sat back down (again perplexed.  Then a server brought a plastic fork and (with attitude) told me that "next time we will not give you one."  Last time I was there I was treated rudely as well, but I thought the food was OK, so I wanted to give them another chance.  I will not be returning.

wSu3Frzd9K5E74WN96wMJg.text: Great food! Terrible customer service!! Servers and cashiers have zero personality. My 3 Stars is based on customer service alone.

AV40VkLiQz-9aYSSdaVgTw.text: Try offering a gyro sandwich with a side Greek salad and not make the customer order two entrees. Some of us like a little healthier option for lunch and don't want fries and a coke with our sandwich. Gyro, fries and drink = $7.95. Gyro and side salad = $13.95.

pSkpklj7KEygBfah-Wm9OQ.text: The Greek salad with chicken is really good. It's very flavorful. We order it frequently. But the owner needs to clean this place up & paint the walls. The walls are filthy. This could be a gold mine.

EIcBaTLtqZk0i7jnf95k5A.text: At this Greek Cafe, you'll order at the counter and the food will be delivered at the table. My friend has been going here for years and this is the first time I have gone with her. The owners are of Greek heritage and the food shows this in flavor and authenticity. The gyro meat is soft and tender and full of flavor. The Tzaatziki sauce is creamy and flavorful - just the consistency I like - unfortunately, if you want more, it'll cost you. The chicken souvlaki is fairly moist and flavorful. The fries are surprisingly crisp for the size. I would definitely recommend this locale if your in the mood for a little greek.

_YuGLi3BX-RkdEobJ5r7lQ.text: Great service, delicious food and very authentic Greek kebobs. Humble atmosphere-amazing food!  And don't forget that they will build catered boxes for big parties too!

FZ2sqO1ckXY8a7Hf7DbgKw.text: This place tears me in two, while I love the cheap Greek food their service truly is bad. It really is something else to experience, just disorganized and mismanaged. They need to have one of those restaurant intervention people to do an episode here, because the place could so easily be better. Again I love their Greek salad, humus and Gyro platter so as I said, the place is what it is. So if you go in with the proper expectations, you'll walk away happy.

msfrBU0Bw0oNmApFWI0ItA.text: I have tried Akropolis three times now over the last seven years with the hope that it has gotten better.  Third time is a charm and no more for me., sadly given the potential for this special nook.    Each time the service has been horrendous.  In fact, rude.  I was actually checking out and the individual ringing me up was on her phone while asking for my money.  For real?  #sad

Tba9Z0GHbhhCZCoJhUAkhA.text: A friend and I got together to catch up for lunch and looked around and decided to try Akropolis. The price of the food was affordable and they had a decent menu to choose from. Unfortunately we experienced very very poor service at our visit today. The man who took our order was very nice and patient with us, since it was our first time and was the only person to really check up on us during our time there. After we ordered our food we waited a long time for our food to arrive to our table. A few moments later one of the servers approached us with an order and announced it as the #9 meal which is what my friend ordered. Five to ten minutes goes by and a food runner drops off a plate of hummus and pita bread. The server dropped it off at our table and maybe mumbled some words then walked away. I wasn't 100% paying attention to them them so I we just started eating the food. Like I mentioned my friend and I have never been here and we honestly just assumed it came with the food we were confused as to why we got it but we just went with it. We understand that we probably should have asked and that was our mistake on our part but like I said we didn't know. A few minutes pass and another server comes by and says she has a #9 ...... my friend already had food in front of her so I simply asked "Do you mean a number 10 because that's what I ordered." The server was rather rude and didn't respond in a nice way at all, all she did was just repeat what she had in her hands. So I took the plate from her and she walked away. No apology, no sympathy or anything, just poor customer service skills. Turns out the first server who approached our table gave my order to my friend but called it the wrong thing. Our meals looked completely different so I am confused as to how she got them mixed up. Then during our meal I assume the manager comes up to us and asks to see our receipts. This was when we found out the hummus and pita didn't come with our meal, she said "You didn't order the hummus, who gave you this food?" I personally do not remember who dropped off our food because we had THREE different servers approach us and like mentioned whoever dropped it off kind of quickly dropped it off then walked away. My friend and I told her that we don't remember who dropped it off and the manager started raising her voice and catching an attitude saying "I know you know exactly who gave it to you and I need you to tell me who dropped this off." I already told her the first time I was not sure and this happened 30 minutes ago. I was not fond of the manager talking down to us as if we were pesky teenagers trying to mess with her. She then continues to yell at the employees from our table and got even more angrier when no one would speak up. Very unprofessional to see. We were checked up on once but the man who took our order and he offered us refills but that was the only time we were really ever checked up on. For the most part the food was mediocre but the service really put me off and won't see myself coming back here again due to the poor service and the lack of care for their customers. I am a server at a restaurant myself and I will always give other servers some wiggle room when things don't go as planned but from the look of this establishment, it is very poorly ran and unorganized.

2CRVmILEE_f1bNf9UyCX4A.text: Stay away! Wow, Akropolis cafe - you really have gone downhill, particularly in the customer service department.  I have been a loyal customer for 18 long years and have loved your food over that time.  I always order ahead from work and come in to pick up and bring back to the office (about 15 min away).  You all know my name when I call to place an order and say hello with my name when I pick up BUT today was a final straw because of your management's lack of customer service. I ordered by phone as usual and you took my phone number too (as always).  I arrived at your restaurant to pick up my food and you told me then that it was cash only as the internet was down and you could not accept credit card payment.  I did not have cash but offered to pay via check (again you all know me - I am in every week for 18 years now).  The ATM for my bank is back by my office 15 minutes away and I had a work conference call to get back to so didn't have time to make the trip to the bank.  You also advised me that you learned the Internet and CC machine were down right after I called in my order.  SO, you could have called me back since you have my phone number to let me know I needed cash to pay.  I was cordial in my feedback to you today and even asked if I could come back and pay later but your manager would not allow.  Very sad that a long time customer was not informed of your issue with Internet yet couldn't pick up a food order when you very likely then had to throw away my order!  What a waste and now you have lost a client for good.  Stay FAR away from this establishment.  I am done now.....

7o6J56eJbmHlYrIEzKLoTw.text: We arrived at the restaurant at around 9:10, almost an entire hour before closing.  We both ordered the chicken souvlaki which came with fries, pita bread, and a salad.  The meal was good although the chicken portions were quite small compared to other restaurants with this same entree. At about 9:36 the suppose to be "supervisor" started to put up chairs on the tables around us.  When I asked if I could get a slice of baklava the "supervisor" was very rude yelling at the guy in the kitchen (who was not Greek by the way) for putting the baklava on a plate instead of in a to go box.  He yelled to him that they were closed even though it was 20 minutes before 10:00.  The girl at the counter was very nice and asked if I wanted it to go.  After hearing the commotion I said that was fine.  Our experience tonight definitely made me long to dine at some of the other Greek restaurants in the area that we were used to.  After experiencing such poor customer service and seeing how badly this place treats their employees I will definitely not be returning.

FKOaeKZvu0la2UNUtPigEA.text: Today was a great experience at Akropolis. I have been here when either the food or the service was not that great. They seem to have stepped up their game. I got the filet kebab and it was great. The gyro platter was good as well. They have a great, fresh, light salad with feta and olives. The fries are crispy and fresh. I was hungry when I got here and was hoping it would be a good day for them. It was.

photos.caption: Photo of Akropolis Cafe At Arboretum - Charlotte, NC, United States

zp5cKNEbAMxLsCFI8zTGew.text: Ever since Clucker's in McMullen Creek closed, I've been on the hunt for a new go-to place for Greek food.  This was my first trip to Akropolis Cafe along with 3 other people. I ordered the #13 Chicken Souvlaki Shishkabob, Greek Salad, Fries & Pita Bread.  The food was good but not fantastic.  It was a good lunch.  For that alone I would gladly give at least 3 stars.  But the tipping point was the horrible lack of service.  When the food was delivered to the table, they forgot the utensils.  I had to literally track someone down, get their attention as ask for knives and forks for the table.  The failure of attention to small details coupled with having hot food sitting in front of you and being unable to eat it is a frustrating experience.  I must say I was a bit put-off by the little sign by the register stating additional tzatziki would cost extra.  Maybe because what they give you to start with is so small, that an extra side is almost required.  Recap: decent food, poor service.  Sigh...the hunt continues....
